intro: Acourtia moschata, commonly known as the musk acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Acourtia moschata is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub ecosystems.
